result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony J Vaughn

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on January 20, 2023 at 10:15 am.

1:41 PM Defendant Anthony J Vaughn in court.  Attorney Jacob A Idlas in court for Anthony J Vaughn.  Attorney Hector Al-Homsi in court for State of Wisconsin. 

State moves to orally amend Count 3 to 946.49(1a) Misd. Bail Jumping. DE states no objection. Court grants oral motion to amend; State to file amended complaint within one week. Sent to branch for scheduling.

2:42 PM Defendant Anthony J Vaughn in court.  Attorney Jacob A Idlas in court for Anthony J Vaughn.  Prosecuting attorney Thersa Louise Lewandowski in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on September 12, 2022 at 02:20 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. - Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with KMG or Amber V. 
- Defendant shall not be at any residence of KMG or Amber V. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 2500 block of Yahara Dr in Mcfarland. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 12

01:55 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Jon Oliver Helland.  Thersa Louise Lewandowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 02:20 pm.
